abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Sustainable
            Forestry for Rural Development (SUFORD) Project for Lao
            People's Democratic Republic is to assist the borrower
            to achieve the sustainable management of production forests
            to alleviate rural poverty in the project provinces by
            implementing the forest policy reform actions and policies
            set forth in its letter of forest management policy. This
            restructuring paper introduces changes in the project and
            accompanying amendments to the project's legal
            documents. Specifically this proposal seeks to extend the
            closing date of the International Development Association
            (IDA) financing for the above-referenced project by twelve
            months from the current closing date of December 31, 2011 to
            December 31, 2012 to provide more time for completion of
            on-going activities especially in ethnic group communities
            that have been delayed due to factors outside the control of
            the government and the project implementing agency. The
            restructuring also includes changes to the financing plan
            and a minor reallocation of grant proceeds amongst
            expenditure categories. Rationale for closing date
            extension. The extension is necessary to provide more time
            for completion of on-going activities especially in ethnic
            group communities that have been delayed due to factors
            outside the control of the government and the project
            implementing agency.
